intro: Rinzia morrisonii, commonly known as the Morrison's rinzia, is a small, flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in heathland and dry woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators such as bees and birds. Rinzia morrisonii is often found in South Australia and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
